resources.string: Note: options below do not affect the resolution and dimension of the final product.
Please choose 2 or more pictures first.
Cannot find common parts between pictures. Please check and ensure added pictures do share common regions and are in the correct order. If they do, please try decreasing sensitivity in options.

Panoramic Screenshot composes pictures by first scanning them in pairs and compare which parts are common among each pair. Below are parameters available for tweaking the scan-and-compare process.

Sensitivity: Controls how much (in percentage) of two lines should be the same in order to consider them identical. This is useful if the screenshots contain minor obstructions, e.g. scroll bars. If you see too much artifact in the result, try increasing this; if the result is totally incorrect, try decreasing this.

Skip Ratio: When comparing each pair, how much of the first picture (from the top) and the second picture (from the bottom) should the algorithm ignore. This can reduce the scanning time dramatically because the overlapping area between each pair should only appear at the bottom of the first and at the top of the second.

Subsample Ratio: When comparing, scale each image down by this amount (e.g. 4 times by default) first. This also reduces scanning time and will not affect the result if not too large. This will not affect the final resolution. Image will still be concatenated in their original size.
